histogram.name: AppBanners.BeforeInstallEvent
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks usage of the BeforeInstallPromptEvent, which allows developers to control when an app banner appears. The events in this histogram are not mutually exclusive - for example, preventDefault() must be called if prompt() is called.

histogram.name: AppBanners.DismissEvent
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks the different ways that an app banner left the screen, e.g. through an automatic dismissal after navigation or an explicit user action.

histogram.name: AppBanners.DisplayEvent
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks when an app banner was requested and how the request was handled, e.g. the user blocked its appearance or the banner was ultimately created.

histogram.name: AppBanners.InstallableStatusCode
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks the status code logged by the app banner system as it processes a site's eligibility for an app banner. Every request for a banner will be logged in a bucket of this histogram.

histogram.name: AppBanners.InstallEvent
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks when a user triggers an install dialog for the app promoted by the banner, as well as whether or not the user ultimately decided to install the app.

histogram.name: AppBanners.MinutesFromFirstVisitToBannerShown
histogram.summary: App banners promote an application related to the current website, and are requested specifically through the current page's HTML. This stat tracks the number of minutes between the first recorded visit to an origin and the time when the banner is actually shown.

histogram.name: AppBanners.UserResponse
histogram.summary: This stat tracks the user reponse when the add-to-homescreen dialog is shown either: (A) Via the website's JavaScript (B) Via the user tapping the app banner which promotes the application related to the current site.

histogram.name: Launch.HomeScreen
histogram.summary: Records how Chrome handled a launch from an Android Home screen shortcut.

histogram.name: Launch.HomeScreenSource
histogram.summary:
Records the source of an Android homescreen launch intent used to launch Chrome.
The Menu item bucket is deprecated as of M57, and will only contain records for shortcuts added to the homescreen until M56.
For M57+, the Menu item (standalone) bucket contains all launch intents originating from the add to homescreen menu item that launch to standalone mode and *are not* WebAPKs. These are sites which do not meet the PWA eligibility criteria, but have an app manifest that specifies either standalone or fullscreen display. This bucket also contains PWA *and* non-PWA intents that were added to the homescreen *prior* to M57, as we cannot distinguish between them after they are added.
For M57+, the Menu item (shortcut) bucket contains all launch intents originating from the add to homescreen menu item that launch to a browser tab, regardless of when the intent was added.

histogram.name: Launch.WebAppDisplayMode
histogram.summary: Records the display mode (as defined in the Web App Manifest spec) at the launch of the Added to Home screen or installed Web App (including WebAPKs).

histogram.name: Webapp.AddToHomescreenDialog.Timeout
histogram.summary: Records the number of milliseconds that the add to homescreen dialog required to check installability eligibility.

histogram.name: Webapp.AddToHomescreenMediator.AppTypeToMenuEntry
histogram.summary: Keeps track of what verbiage was shown in the App menu versus what was actually installed.

histogram.name: Webapp.AppIdentityDialog.AlreadyApproved
histogram.summary: Whenever PWAs change their manifest, this may result in a change to their identity (icon and/or name). This metric is intended to keep track of the combinations of App Identity changes that were requested (changes to the icons and/or app name -- plus icon masks and/or shortname on Android). This metric is logged once each time Chrome determines that a PWA is in need of an update, but ONLY if the change should be auto-approved. On Android that happens when the user has approved the App Identity dialog with identical data before (and another update request comes in), and on Desktop platforms that happens when Default apps/Policy apps are pre-approved for updating -- or when changes happening to icons are for sizes not deemed important to monitor. See also complementary metric Webapp.AppIdentityDialog.NotShowing.

histogram.name: Webapp.AppIdentityDialog.NotShowing
histogram.summary: Whenever PWAs change their manifest, this may result in a change to their identity (icon and/or name). This metric is intended to keep track of the combinations of App Identity changes that were requested (changes to the icons and/or app name -- plus icon masks and/or shortname on Android). This metric is logged once each time Chrome determines that a PWA is in need of an update, but ONLY if there is no App Identity change involved (or the App Identity dialog is disabled by a feature switch). See also complementary metric Webapp.AppIdentityDialog.Showing.

histogram.name: Webapp.AppIdentityDialog.Showing
histogram.summary: Whenever PWAs change their manifest, this may result in a change to their identity (icon and/or name). This metric is intended to keep track of the combinations of App Identity changes that were requested (changes to the icons and/or app name -- plus icon masks and/or shortname on Android). This metric is logged once each time Chrome determines that a PWA is in need of an update, but ONLY if there is an App Identity change involved (the App Identity dialog is enabled by a feature switch and the dialog was shown to the user). See also complementary metric Webapp.AppIdentityDialog.NotShowing.

histogram.name: WebApp.AppSettingsPage.EntryPoints
histogram.summary: Records the source of certain navigations to chrome://app-settings. Recording happens at the given entry point, and not during the loading of chrome://app-settings, so direct visits to the URL are not recorded.

histogram.name: Webapp.CheckServiceWorker.Status
histogram.summary: Records the result of the check if a PWA has a service worker with a fetch event handler when the CheckOfflineCapability feature is disabled. When the feature is enabled, records the result of the check if a PWA supports offline pages with a service worker.

histogram.name: Webapp.CheckServiceWorker.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time to complete the check if a PWA has a service worker with a fetch event handler when the CheckOfflineCapability feature is disabled. When the feature is enabled, records the time to complete the check if a PWA supports offline pages with a service worker.

histogram.name: WebApp.Database.WriteResult
histogram.summary: Records if modifying data in the web app database was successful. Recorded whenever the database is written to, which can happen on large events like installing a web app, as well as small events like changing a the user display preference for a web app.

histogram.name: WebApp.Engagement
histogram.summary: The type of engagement (navigation, user input, etc.) which led to an accumulation in site engagement within a web app window or tab. Should be collected for a subset of SiteEngagementService.EngagementType, which is triggered for all browsing contexts. Recorded at the time of engagement accumulation (e.g., when mouse is clicked).

histogram.name: WebApp.Icon.DownloadedHttpStatusCodeOnCreate
histogram.summary: The HTTP status code returned for a list of icons when installing single WebApp. Recorded when WebAppInstallTask finishes downloading icons for non-sync installs. Icon download attempts with identical codes produce only one event for this histogram.

histogram.name: WebApp.Icon.DownloadedHttpStatusCodeOnSync
histogram.summary: The HTTP status code returned for a list of icons when installing single WebApp. Recorded when WebAppInstallTask finishes downloading icons for web apps from sync. Icon download attempts with identical codes produce only one event for this histogram.

histogram.name: WebApp.Icon.DownloadedHttpStatusCodeOnUpdate
histogram.summary: The HTTP status code returned for a list of icons when updating single WebApp. Recorded when ManifestUpdateTask finishes downloading icons for update. Icon download attempts with identical codes produce only one event for this histogram.

histogram.name: WebApp.Icon.DownloadedResultOnCreate
histogram.summary: The overall result returned by WebAppIconDownloader. Recorded when WebAppInstallTask finishes downloading icons for non-sync installs.

histogram.name: WebApp.Icon.DownloadedResultOnSync
histogram.summary: The overall result returned by WebAppIconDownloader. Recorded when WebAppInstallTask finishes downloading icons for web aps from sync.

histogram.name: WebApp.Icon.DownloadedResultOnUpdate
histogram.summary: The overall result returned by WebAppIconDownloader. Recorded when ManifestUpdateTask finishes downloading icons.

histogram.name: WebApp.Icon.HttpStatusCodeClassOnCreate
histogram.summary: The HTTP status code class returned for each icon loaded during a WebApp's creation. Recorded when WebAppInstallTask finishes downloading icons.

histogram.name: WebApp.Icon.HttpStatusCodeClassOnSync
histogram.summary: The HTTP status code class returned for each icon loaded when syncing a WebApp. Recorded when WebAppInstallTask finishes downloading icons on sync.

histogram.name: WebApp.Icon.HttpStatusCodeClassOnUpdate
histogram.summary: The HTTP status code class returned for each icon loaded when updating a WebApp. Recorded when ManifestUpdateTask finishes downloading icons.

histogram.name: Webapp.Install.DisplayMode2
histogram.summary: Records the display mode (as defined in the Web App Manifest spec) at the install time of a WebApp. Fixes a bug in the data collection for desktop web apps.

histogram.name: Webapp.Install.InstallBounce
histogram.summary: Records when a web app install bounced for different install sources. A bounce is when the user uninstalls the web app within 1 hour of installing it.

histogram.name: Webapp.Install.InstallEvent
histogram.summary: Records the mechanism and source from which a web app installation was triggered, regardless of whether the installation was successful.

histogram.name: WebApp.Install.Result
histogram.summary: This is recorded when a web app installation is completed. This tracks all kinds of web app installations, e.g. user installs from install icon or admin installs from WebAppInstallForcelist.

histogram.name: WebApp.Install.SyncFallbackInstallInitiated
histogram.summary: This is recorded when a web app install from the sync system fails and the fallback install is initiated. Sync installations happen when the sync system tells the local client that a web app has been installed on the profile on a different device. This often happens during startup. The value is the error code for the regular install flow.

histogram.name: Webapp.Install.UninstallEvent
histogram.summary: Records the mechanism and source from which a web app uninstallation was triggered, regardless of whether the uninstallation was successful.

histogram.name: WebApp.InstallConfirmation.CloseReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason that the WebApp install confirmation dialog is closed. This dialog is shown when the user clicks on the 'install' icon in the omnibox for websites that are installable. This metric is intended to give data for an experiment to choose the best install icon.

histogram.name: WebApp.InstallIphPromo.Result
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated on 2022-04. Collected metrics on IPH usage and no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Records the result of user reaction to In Product Help promo for Web App Install.

histogram.name: Webapp.InstallResult
histogram.summary: Records the result code of Web App installs.

histogram.name: WebApp.Launcher.LaunchResult
histogram.summary: The result of a Progressive Web App (PWA) launcher's attempt to launch Chrome. Windows-only.

histogram.name: WebApp.Launcher.UpdateResult
histogram.summary: The result of updating a single Progressive Web App (PWA) launcher with the latest version of chrome_pwa_launcher.exe. Windows-only.

histogram.name: WebApp.Mover.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of running the WebAppMover, which runs on Chrome startup. It uninstalls a set of WebApps and then installs a single WebApp as a replacement.

histogram.name: Webapp.NavigationStatus
histogram.summary: Records whether the top-level navigations in standalone Web Apps result in presenting the web content or showing the error page.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.AppDuplicationFixApplied
histogram.summary:
Chrome apps migrated to preinstalled web apps encountered an issue where apps became duplicated, see https://crbug.com/1266234.
The PreinstalledWebAppDuplicationFixer was added to fix users that encountered duplicate apps. See https://crbug.com/1290716. This metric records how many app duplications got fixed.
This gets recorded at start up after Chrome apps have loaded.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.AppToReplaceStillDefaultInstalledCount
histogram.summary:
Preinstalled web app configs can specify a set of apps to uninstall after the preinstalled web app is installed.
This records how many apps that are meant to be uninstalled are still default installed; see https://crbug.com/1266234.
This gets recorded at start up after preinstalled web apps configs have been applied.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.AppToReplaceStillInstalledCount
histogram.summary:
Preinstalled web app configs can specify a set of apps to uninstall after the preinstalled web app is installed.
This records how many apps that are meant to be uninstalled are still installed. This could occur due to manual installation by the user or Chrome app sync, see https://crbug.com/1266234.
This gets recorded at start up after preinstalled web apps configs have been applied.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.AppToReplaceStillInstalledInShelfCount
histogram.summary:
Preinstalled web app configs can specify a set of apps to uninstall after the preinstalled web app is installed.
This records how many apps that are meant to be uninstalled are still installed and present in the Chrome OS shelf; see https://crbug.com/1266234.
This gets recorded at start up after preinstalled web apps configs have been applied.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.ConfigErrorCount
histogram.summary: Records how many preinstalled web app config files failed to parse as valid JSON with valid fields. See preinstalled_web_app_utils.cc ParseConfig(). This is recorded at start up.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.DisabledCount
histogram.summary: Records how many preinstalled web apps configs were disabled for the device. This is recorded at start up.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.DisabledReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason a preinstalled installation was disabled. This is recorded at startup for every app in the preinstalled apps list, before it is sent to the ExternallyManagedAppManger for synchronization.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.EnabledCount
histogram.summary: Records how many preinstalled web apps configs were enabled for the device. This is recorded at start up.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.MigratingWebAppAbsentChromeAppAbsent
histogram.summary: Records how many preinstalled web apps that are migrating from Chrome apps are not installed and their Chrome app is not installed either. This is recorded at start up.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.MigratingWebAppAbsentChromeAppPresent
histogram.summary: Records how many preinstalled web apps that are migrating from Chrome apps are not installed and their Chrome app is installed. This is recorded at start up.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.MigratingWebAppPresentChromeAppAbsent
histogram.summary: Records how many preinstalled web apps that are migrating from Chrome apps are installed and their Chrome app is not installed. This is recorded at start up.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.MigratingWebAppPresentChromeAppPresent
histogram.summary: Records how many preinstalled web apps that are migrating from Chrome apps are installed and their Chrome app is installed as well. This is recorded at start up.

histogram.name: WebApp.Preinstalled.UninstallAndReplaceCount
histogram.summary: Records how many preinstalled web app installations uninstalled and replaced an old default app (web app or Chrome app). This corresponds to the "uninstall_and_replace" field in preinstalled web app configs.

histogram.name: WebApp.Shortcuts.Creation.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of shortcut creation for PWA.

histogram.name: Webapp.SyncInitiatedUninstallResult
histogram.summary: Records uninstallation result for sync initiated uninstalls in the new USS-based web applications system.

histogram.name: Webapp.SystemApps.BackgroundTaskStartDelay
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in 2022-04. Collected histogram shows the feature is working as intended. Histogram is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Records how long the SWA background task waits for the system to become idle before starting to run. Recorded in milliseconds, from 1 millisecond to 1 hour. This is logged when a SWA background task starts.

histogram.name: Webapp.SystemApps.BadNavigate.Type
histogram.summary: Records the type of System Web App that caused a bad navigation. This is used to trigger a Perfetto trace to provide more debugging information. See crbug.com/1201820 for more details.

histogram.name: Webapp.SystemApps.FreshInstallDuration
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to perform a fresh install of all system web apps. It measures the time from when we dispatch a call to install them, until we get all the installation results. This intentionally excludes the scenario where we don't request to install all the apps for consistency. Recorded in milliseconds, from 1 millisecond to 3 minutes.

histogram.name: WebApp.Uninstall.IconDataSuccess
histogram.summary: Records if removing icon data from disk was successful during webapp uninstall, before the webapp is removed from the database. Uninstall can occur from the user, enterprise policy, device policy, or chrome sync.

histogram.name: WebApp.Uninstall.NonSyncIncompleteCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of incomplete uninstalls that were found on startup. These web apps are immediately scheduled for uninstall again. This does NOT include webapps that uninstalled from sync - any incomplete uninstalls from sync cannot be counted.

histogram.name: WebApp.Uninstall.OsHookSuccess
histogram.summary: Records if uninstalling OS hooks was successful during webapp uninstall, before the webapp is removed from the database. Uninstall can occur from the user, enterprise policy, device policy, or chrome sync.

histogram.name: WebApp.Uninstall.Result
histogram.summary: Records if uninstallation was successful. Uninstall can occur from the user, enterprise policy, device policy, or chrome sync.

histogram.name: Webapp.UninstallDialogAction
histogram.summary: Records the user response to the dialog shown when uninstalling a web app.

histogram.name: Webapp.Update.ManifestUpdateResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of web app manifest update checks during page navigations. Note that "No app in scope" results are ignored due to the expected several orders of magnitude higher volume than all other update results.

histogram.name: Webapp.Update.ManifestUpdateResult.DefaultApp
histogram.summary: Identical to Webapp.Update.ManifestUpdateResult but restricted to just default installed web apps.

histogram.name: WebApp.UrlHandling.DialogState
histogram.summary: Records the user action taken on the URL Handling intent picker dialog.

histogram.name: WebApp.UrlHandling.GetValidProfilesAtStartUp
histogram.summary: Measure the time it takes to collect (loading as needed) the set of profiles eligible to handle a URL by a PWA at startup for URL Handling. Emitted for users with high resolution clocks only.

histogram.name: WebApp.UrlHandling.LoadWebAppRegistrarsAtStartUp
histogram.summary: Measure the time it takes to load all the web app registrars for URL Handling at startup. Emitted for users with high resolution clocks only.

histogram.name: Webapp.WebAppOriginAssociationFetchResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of web app origin association file fetch when url handlers are present. Happens when PWA is installed or updated.

histogram.name: Webapp.WebAppOriginAssociationParseResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of web app origin association file parsing. Happens after an web app origin association file is fetched.

histogram.name: Webapp.WebAppUrlLoaderPrepareForLoadResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of WebAppUrlLoader::PrepareForLoad().
